description: Explore arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and hash tables

slides.title: Introduction
slides.content:
# Data Structures ðŸ“Š

## Why Important?
- Organize data efficiently
- Optimize operations
- Foundation of algorithms

## Categories
| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Linear | Array, List, Stack, Queue |
| Non-linear | Tree, Graph, Hash |

slides.title: Arrays & Lists
slides.content:
# Arrays & Linked Lists ðŸ“¦

## Array
- Fixed size
- O(1) access by index
- O(n) insert/delete

## Linked List
- Dynamic size
- O(n) access
- O(1) insert/delete at ends

slides.title: Stacks & Queues
slides.content:
# Stacks & Queues ðŸ“š

## Stack (LIFO)
- Push: Add to top
- Pop: Remove from top
- Uses: Undo, function calls

## Queue (FIFO)
- Enqueue: Add to back
- Dequeue: Remove from front
- Uses: Task scheduling

slides.title: Trees
slides.content:
# Trees ðŸŒ³

## Binary Tree
- Max 2 children per node
- Root, parent, child, leaf

## BST Operations
| Op | Average | Worst |
|----|---------|-------|
| Search | O(log n) | O(n) |
| Insert | O(log n) | O(n) |
| Delete | O(log n) | O(n) |

slides.title: Hash Tables
slides.content:
# Hash Tables ðŸ”‘

## Concept
```
Key â†’ Hash function â†’ Index â†’ Value
```

## Performance
| Op | Average |
|----|---------|
| Insert | O(1) |
| Search | O(1) |
| Delete | O(1) |

## Collisions
- Chaining
- Open addressing

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Summary ðŸŽ‰

- Array: O(1) access, O(n) insert
- Stack: LIFO
- Queue: FIFO
- BST: O(log n) operations
- Hash: O(1) average
